title: South Africa Champions vs Pakistan Champions Highlights, WCL 2025: All-Round Shoaib Malik Leads Pak To 31-Run Win
description: South Africa Champions vs Pakistan Champions Highlights, WCL 2025: South Africa Champions are chasing a 199-run target against Pakistan Champions.
excerpt: South Africa Champions vs Pakistan Champions Highlights, WCL 2025: South Africa Champions are chasing a 199-run target against Pakistan Champions.
text: South Africa Champions vs Pakistan Champions Highlights, WCL 2025© AFP South Africa Champions vs Pakistan Champions Highlights, World Championship of Legends 2025: Table-toppers South Africa Champions crushed to their first defeat of the season. It was Pakistan Champions who outplayed the side in the 9th match of World Championship of Legends 2025 on Friday. South Africa Champions captain Aaron Phangiso won the toss and opted to bowl first. Umar Amin scored a fifty (58) while Shoaib Malik contributed with 46 not out as Pakistan Champions posted 198 for 5 in the alloted 20 overs. Duanne Olivier was the pick of the bowlers for the South Africa Champions with figures of 2 for 19 in three overs. In the chase, the Proteas failed to get going and eventually posted 167 for 9, losing the game by 31 runs. (Scorecard) South Africa Champions vs Pakistan Champions, WCL 2025 Highlights - Topics mentioned in this article Show full article
html:
South Africa Champions vs Pakistan Champions Highlights, WCL 2025© AFP

South Africa Champions vs Pakistan Champions Highlights, World Championship of Legends 2025: Table-toppers South Africa Champions crushed to their first defeat of the season. It was Pakistan Champions who outplayed the side in the 9th match of World Championship of Legends 2025 on Friday. South Africa Champions captain Aaron Phangiso won the toss and opted to bowl first. Umar Amin scored a fifty (58) while Shoaib Malik contributed with 46 not out as Pakistan Champions posted 198 for 5 in the alloted 20 overs. Duanne Olivier was the pick of the bowlers for the South Africa Champions with figures of 2 for 19 in three overs. In the chase, the Proteas failed to get going and eventually posted 167 for 9, losing the game by 31 runs. (Scorecard)
